name: Office of Personnel Management
description: The Office of Personnel Management provides human resources leadership and support to federal agencies and administers benefits, retirement, and healthcare programs for federal employees.

painPoints.point: Retirement services system modernization to improve processing times and customer service for federal retirees
Federal employee healthcare enrollment and benefits administration system improvements
Cybersecurity and data protection following previous data breaches, critical for sensitive employee information
Human resources data systems integration and modernization across federal agencies
Federal job application and hiring system (USAJOBS) improvements and scalability

IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting retirement services and benefits IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

secondary: GAO Reports on OPM IT Security and Modernization

evaluationFactors: Past performance with HR or benefits systems

keyOffices: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO)
insights: Cybersecurity is critical priority following previous data breaches
Retirement services system modernization is a major focus
Federal employee benefits administration requires ongoing improvements
IT infrastructure modernization priorities across all programs
Strong emphasis on protecting sensitive employee data
